page.title: 08ECOLOGY-1
page.content:
The area surrounding the three villages is mainly covered with farm land enclosed by cut hedges of hawthorn,elm,field maple and ash with mature trees of ash,oak,crab apple and wild pear.Elm trees are starting to grow again since all mature trees were destroyed in 1976 by{Dutch Elm {Disease.}Groups and farmers are planting oak,ash,lime,willow,maple, birch and hornbeam.Hedge saplings including elm are being left uncut by some farmers.
There are areas of deciduous woodland on Idlicote Hill chiefly "Hell Brake" of 18 acres.These provide cover for herds of up to 100 fallow deer, including some of almost white colouring.Other wildlife are muntjac deer,badgers,foxes,weasels,stoats, grey squirrels and grass snakes.
